alert.note: Alert for Inland Taylor; Lafayette; Madison (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 01 at 3:36PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN LAFAYETTE... NORTHEASTERN TAYLOR AND SOUTHEASTERN MADISON COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM EDT... At 335 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles west of Dowling Park, or 14 miles northeast of Perry, moving northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Madison, Lee, Townsend, Moseley Hall, Chancey, Smith, Hopewell, Buckville, Day, and Mayo Junction. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
